H0.text: Metamorphosis is the process that makes it possible for plants to use energy from sunlight to produce their own food.

H1.text: Photosynthesis is the process that makes it possible for plants to use energy from sunlight to produce their own food.

H2.text: Pollination is the process that makes it possible for plants to use energy from sunlight to produce their own food.

H3.text: Reproduction is the process that makes it possible for plants to use energy from sunlight to produce their own food.

A4.text: Photosynthesis is a system of biological processes by which photopigment-bearing autotrophic organisms, such as most plants, algae and cyanobacteria, convert light energy — typically from sunlight — into the chemical energy necessary to fuel their metabolism.

A5.text: Most photosynthetic organisms are photoautotrophs, which means that they are able to synthesize food directly from carbon dioxide and water using energy from light.
